column4: Hmm, how do I force an apt-get install to not care about dependencies?
Ok, back to me... Forcing install in spite of "missing" deps.
'man apt-get' reveals '--ignore-missing', though i imagine that is likely to cause tears in the long run
Nah, it's just bitching about libc6 being labeled 2.3.2.ds1-20ubuntu13 and not 2.3.2.ds1-21... I don't think it'll be that bad.
Hmm, --ignore-missing doesn't cut it. apt-get still bitches.
read 'man apt-get' --- it mentions combining that with what kvidell mentioned.
the stars are not in your favour
i guess you're not ignoring 'missing' packages -- libc isn't missing, it's got the wrong version
i've never used the 'equivs' package, but it's description is 'Circumvent Debian package dependencies'
I installed from a Warty CD and upgraded... (Loooong wait there.)
hey, i'm on 56kb :P took me 40 hours (or more?) to download hoary
